isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - AIR-TO-AIR CHARGE AIR COOLER - OPERATION

svcproc.title: OPERATION
svcproc.para: From the air intake, air passes through the air cleaner to remove dust and grit from the air supply. Then the air is routed to the turbocharger, which is mounted directly on the outlet flange of the engine exhaust manifold ( Figure 6).

The turbocharger is powered by energy extracted from exhaust gasses to turn a turbine wheel. A shaft connects the turbine wheel to the compressor wheel. The compressor wheel blades pressurize (charge) the air, then route it to the charge air cooler ( Figure 7).

calloutgroup.callout1: 5. TURBINE EXHAUST GAS OUTLET TO MUFFLER (A)
6. EXHAUST GAS INLET FROM EXHAUST MANIFOLD (A)
7. COMPRESSED AIR DISCHARGE TO CHARGE AIR COOLER (B)
8. AMBIENT AIR INLET FROM AIR CLEANER (B)

svcproc.para: The charge air cooler core transfers heat to the atmosphere to lower the temperature of the charged air as it passes through - from about 300°F. (149°C.) to about 120°F. (49°C.). The reduced-temperature charged air is then delivered to the engine air intake manifold. The cooled air is also condensed, so that more air can be "packed" into the cylinder combustion chamber to improve engine efficiency.
The engine fan draws ambient air through the radiator and charge air cooler cores, and around the engine. This provides needed air flow, especially when the vehicle is moving slowly.
